title: Roman Holiday - March 2007
name: Roman Holiday - March 2007
description:
A Map by Eberlin

Where I went

properties.name: Colosseum
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin One wonders how they built it all those years ago and how many people had to die building it and then after.....

properties.name: Da Armando Al Pantheon
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin Instrumental in developing the Slow Food ethos and indeed the food was good. Book if you want a table.

properties.name: Dal Toscano
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin Good lunch full of Romans. If you want something near to The Vatican to fuel you for the Museums, come here.

properties.name: Galleria Borghese
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin Marble sculptures to marvel at. Almost as good as the Chatsworth marble room.....

properties.name: Gogol Statue
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin I liked reading Gogol when I was younger and I must reread his stories. Situated in a rare bit of greenery.

properties.name: Hotel Daphne
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin Where we stayed. Very friendly and very, very helpful. They booked us consistently excellent restaurants. We benefited from an insiders guide to Rome.

properties.name: Il Chianti
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin Tuscan restaurant near the Trevi Fountain. Very good food. Very busy.

properties.name: Osteria Dell' Ingegno
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin

properties.name: Palatine Hill
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin We had a lovely picnic here. Sitting on ancient stones and watching the tour guides being informative. Good views of ancient Rome

properties.name: Pantheon
properties.description: Posted by EberlinFight through the scrum and enjoy the interior. Marvel at the pillars by the entrance. Sit by the fountain and watch the world go by.

properties.name: Piazza Del Popolo
properties.description: Posted by EberlinAnother place to sit and watch. That is all.

properties.name: Piazza Navona
properties.description: Posted by EberlinSit and watch. That is all. Despite there being no more chariot races here, there is still enough to entertain you.

properties.name: Ristorante Colline Emillian
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin Good meat. All our food was good on this holiday.

properties.name: S Maria Maggiore
properties.description: Posted by EberlinBig church. Interesting interior

properties.name: San Crispino Gelati
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin The best ice cream in Rome. Need I say more?

properties.name: San Marco
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin

properties.name: The Best Coffee
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin  It\'s the first time that I have been to a cafe where getting served is like getting a beer from a bar at a gig. I used all my experience to get to the front and enjoy a fine coffee.

properties.name: The Forum
properties.description: Posted by Eberlin When I first went to Rome about 20 years ago, I had very little money. If only I had known this was free I would have visited....

properties.name: The Vatican
properties.description: Posted by EberlinThe Sistine Chapel and Raphael was probably the highlight of my visit to Rome. Glorious. St Peters is a very big church....

properties.name: Trevi Fountain
properties.description: Posted by EberlinWhy do so many people congregate here? It\'s a fountain. Nice.
